A true story of a man that is married with children in Alaska that was a cold blooded killer of young girls and women!  To his neighbors and friends he was a typical nice guy.  The director does an excellent job to bring you into the reality and fear of the women that where victims and his total evil brutality.  This is a good movie and lesson that there is evil in this life and we must be ready to defend our self, our family, and young women.  For this reason alone I believe Frozen Ground should be seen to see how fragile life is between good and evil.

I realize that this movie is based on a true story, but I found the story a bit tiresome.  Then, at the end, because it was based on a true story, I felt like they missed an opportunity to connect with the audience.  On a lesser note, it seemed like there were a couple unnecessary jabs at Christians.

It was tiresome because the heroine took so long to figure out that the police were trying to help her and that she wasn't safe on her own.  That's actually realistic but--I admit--I have little patience for people who refuse to be helped.  Unfortunately, Cage had no other option but to "partner with [the] near victim and the only witness to escape the clutches of the serial killer in order to bring the murderer to justice."  I'm not sure how, but the director should have captured her apprehensions in a less agonizing way.

I watched to the end because the murderer was one step ahead of them through the entire movie and I had to know if he would be brought to justice.  You'll have to watch the movie to find out for yourself.  In that respect, it was a compelling story.

At the end, the closing credits reminded us that the movie was based on a true story and showed photos of the victims.  I can say without spoiling the movie that the heroine was a prostitute and that much of the movie centered around sex trafficking and prostitution.  After the victim photos would have been an excellent opportunity for a public service announcement of some sort.  There could have been a plea to parents who need help talking to their children, to children considering turning to the streets, to victims who are afraid to speak out, or even to people who suspect that a loved one is acting strangely (a "see something, say something" plea).  There was none of that, though.  So, after watching this brutal movie about victims, I felt hollow because there was no call to action and no outlet for any of the emotion that the movie stirred up.

Great movie because it was very thrilling and full of suspense without stupid explosions and endless car chases!
The acting was superb. All what you only expected from a Hitchcock movie, but sadly it was a true story.

These events really happened. They are captured in a more or less linear fashion in this movie that is set in Alaska. I liked the movie *most* because it's almost a documentary of the events that occurred -- and I love documentaries. It helps to have Cage and Cusack as the lead actors. Another reason that I liked the movie was that I've just returned from Alaska and co-incidentally visited a couple of these very places. The names and places resonated with me.

The sets and the acting is quite understated. I like that too. Watch this movie if you want to see a psycho-thriller.
makes one want to move to alaska because of the scenery, and makes one want to watch it again because of the intensity. have watched it twice now, and was still on edge the second time!

I have always been a fan of John Cusack and Nicolas Cage. It has been awhile since they've "starred" in anything worthy, having said that, I find this movie surprisingly good. It stayed true to the actual "story" and they played their roles convincingly. John Cusack as Hansen was down right creepy. To see him play a different kind of role was refreshing, creepy but refreshing nonetheless. Nic Cage's acting was fitting in my opinion. I have not seen him commit to a character like this since "Face Off." Vanessa Hudgens aka Ms. High School Musical was much better than I expected. I remember seeing a couple of other films she played in which left me feeling "meh." This however shows that she actually has ability to not only act but to act well; which is very promising. The extras playing victims, side story and supporting law enforment characters help round out the film. The only "um okay" moment was seeing Mr. 50 Cent in his 70s-ish outfit. Not used to seeing that; at all.

Alaska is such a beautiful place and its serenity is can be downright scary at times. The setting and scenery are reminiscent of the time period and it creates a picture of how and what it was like to be there as things unfolded.

Overall, a very engaging movie not in a sense on "who did it" but more along the lines of "this is what happened and this is how it went down." As for the other reviews, everyone has their own opinions and my opinion concludes that this is a very good film with very convincing acting. Cheers.

This is not a movie for everyone, though it would be great if everyone saw it. It's not exactly entertaining, but it is riveting. Well produced, well put together, well directed, well written, and well acted, the fact that it is based on true events, and that they are allowed to unfold without excessive Hollywood adjustments makes it a kind of honorable memorial to the dozens of victims revealed to us in closing credits. It is also a very, very good film.

Nick Cage and John Cusack turn in solid, credible performances and are to be commended for setting their dials to "Real", leaving the equally real but more important job for Vanessa Hudgens. Yes, High School Musical songbird Vanessa Hudgens.  Here she is a 17 year old kid, a runaway, a prostitute, a victim of Cusack's methodical character, and a survivor who is quick in the one moment that keeps her alive but too young and disorganized to think ahead to what might keep her safe after escaping from the first of two encounters.

I have given away nothing. The sense of dread that I felt watching this movie came not from movie manipulation but very naturally from watching a vulnerable young girl who was brutalized first by her own family, then by her choices and then as well by a genuine monster and an overburdened, unresponsive system of law enforcement. None of this is just thrown in. It all comes out slowly and effectively.

Vanessa Hudgens and all who put her character front and center in this story deserve high marks.

Even an honorable memorial cannot bring any of the victims back, but it does do some justice in showing us how easily such things happen. That's worth something out here in the real world.
Interesting mix of seedy life, rural complexities and big outdoors...good role for Cage, and lots of gritty realism...ending might surprise

I watched this free on Amazon Prime. Hard to believe that such a powerhouse film is available for free. I've been to Alaska, know folks who've hunted there, and others, men who live on the periphery of life. This film is beautifully directed, beautifully edited and moves toward an unrelenting climax. Not pretty--but darkly beautiful as a work of film art.

Cage, Cusack & Vanessa Hudgens were fabulous. It is unfortunate such evil people live amongst us. If you can tolerate the real depiction of businesses that solicit & exploit women, then this movie is for you.

Setting was intriguing in that it allowed for believability that so many bodies could be hidden for so many years. Desolation of Alaskan area firmly established. Show was also effective in establishing developing horror of crimes committed and mounting frustration of investigator in trying to nail the murderer and stop his criminal rampage. I thought Cusak was especially effective in his portrayal of the suspect. The ending reminded me of some of the better "The Closer" endings as Cage very effectively uses his only eyewitness against the suspect. As a lawyer, I was puzzled by the relunctance of the DA to proceed with prosecution even after the results of the searches of the suspect's property. There was a lot of circumstantial evidence against the suspect and many, many convictions have been obtained on just circumstantial evidence.

If you like Criminal Minds you will like this movie, which is based on real life events.

Nicholas Cage's usual monotone speech and "thoughtful" look serve him well in this movie.  John Cusack's acting is spot on. The fact that the events take place in Alaska make the movie even more dramatic.

This was a very good movie.  Lots of suspense and hard to believe someone would do something like this. It makes you think!

So many of the victims in this movie could have been saved if the system in place at the time allowed more justice to these "underground" woman, those who have taken to walking the streets to escape a life worse than prostitution.  John Cusack is riveting as a soulless, subhuman man, frozen in humanity towards others, he plays a man that is like a robot, pretending to be decent and neighborly, but without kindness or true friendliness.  Just methodical and matter-of-fact.  He had been getting away with crimes against women for decades, and believed himself to be above the law.  Until one courageous runaway teen prostitute, a girl used to running, and used to escaping from violence, stayed to help a single cop finally put an end to this hunting spree.
Nicolas Cage is great in this movie. The trill of this movie is that you keep thinking that he will be caught, but he keeps slipping away from Cage.

I love historic fiction. This one is about the Hanson murders and I don't know enough about them to say how true or fictional this story is but I can say that this story totally gripped me and was believable. It's on the long side. It reveals how complex our law enforcement is (and how it disables itself) and how complex this man was in his private world. Even though I came away with these sad understandings, the movie left me with a good feeling for the perseverance of those who truly care and how one person can make such a difference (both good and bad). So it's not cynical. It's fresh. I'm glad I watched it.

Acting was great. Directing was also great. My main critique is that they used the Bible on the front but didn't stick to the Bible for the rest of the film. Like Romans 5:20 "Wherever sin abounds, grace much more abounds." This film is a testimony to the ones who righted the wronged. But realistically, the film never represented much more than a narrow escape, unlike the reference in Romans. .

You can throw money at the problem, You can throw agents, lawyers, doctors but only Christ, at His appearing; the real Jesus Christ, He is the solution for world corruption and the unrepentant cops and criminals alike, who are trying to escape big city corruption that is plaguing our nation and our world. The only words I have for this problem is that Jesus did in fact die an innocent man, and it seems to address the blood lust problem, confusing the judiciary, the legislators and those executing the enforcement. (Ex 23:2, Mat 12:7, John 16:33,)

Nicholas Cage plays a policeman who must prove that a religious well respected family man is a serial killer, responsible for the brutal murders of many young women over the span of more than a decade.  A terrific acting job by all the actors - Cage and Cusack at their usual best.  As someone watching the movie, I am reminded of some of the personal safety rules - the first one being never get into vehicles with strangers.  Most importantly, when someone is trying to abduct you, you need to scream, run, kick, resist - do NOT let anyone take you to a secondary location - even if they threaten you, or say that they have your mother's address, etc. Worry about the defense of your family later, should your abductor even have those further motives. These perpetrators' goal is to get you away from a public area where they can do their evil.  After they have committed crimes against you, no matter how much you plead and say you won't tell anyone, they will not take a chance and leave you alive.  Your best chance (not a guarantee) of survival is to not cooperate - don't let them take you anywhere, even with a gun to your head.  When you resist and scream, it immediately catches them off guard because it is going against their well-laid out plans.  I hope you remember these points if you watch this movie, and ask yourself that if you were the victim, when might you have had the opportunity to change your fate.

Very good movie. One of the better roles for Nicholas cage too. It brought this sad event back. Once it was over I definitely had to look up the main characters to try to find out info since this did happen.

I think it would have been a better movie if it had dealt more with the psychological makeup of the killer and his interactions with the world rather than the overkill of topless sex trade.

John and nick do a great job.
Nicolas Cage is good but the story is depressing.  I understand that the ending isn't bad but the topic is depressing.
easy to follow. decent acting.... not a nic cage fan, but this is good. john cusack steals the movie though...
Did not like and found it hard to follow.  Would not watch and would not suggest it for some one.
We were intrigued from the beginning to end.  Chilling to think that it is a true story.  All actors were exceptional.
Nicholas has done quite a bit better, esp. in Face Off etc. Just another "Who done it", except with more nudity showing the seemier side of Anchorage.

Of course I love Nicholas Cage and this movie, especially being true was very good.  I would recommend it to anyone
who likes suspense.
good movie and very enjoyable. John Cusak is extremely believable as the obsessed killer. We never find out what started his killing spree  but it is a true story...Ugh!
The plot was very predictable but having both Nick Cage and John Cusack in it make it work out well
Intriguing, heart racing, emotional rollercoaster of a movie.  I always enjoyed Nicholas Cage as an Actor and in this movie he continues to amaze me.
I love Nicolas Cage as an actor.  This was high action-packed and a real fun movie to watch.  I highly recommend this.
Be warned the language is rough but the story kept me watching. Good acting and I always enjoy Nicholas Cage.
I love Nicholas Cage and he doesn't disappoint in this movie either. This is more of a suspenseful drama, not really my kind of movie, but the acting was spot on.

The movie was really good and I would have given it at least one more star but most of  it took place in the dark and it was so dark most of the time that it made it really hard to see.  The story was very good though.  Just wish it would have been a bit lighter.

The part played by Nicolas Cage was fairly well developed and not filled with too many clichs. The book is always better but movies with Cage starring are usually pretty good and this one keeps with the norm.

Frozen Ground is based on the true story of Alaskan serial killer Robert Hansen (played by Cusack), an upstanding businessman in the community, who basically had gone unnoticed for 13 years.  Nick Cage plays the detective who makes it his personal mission to bring Hansen to justice when he meets the 16 year-old victim who escaped Hansen.  The higher-ups refuse to take him seriously, but he remains determined.  Beautiful Alaskan scenery, okay acting, definitely worth a watch.
It was an excellent movie. There were a few surprises .  Nicholas Cage provided a fine performance. I like the cat and mouse story
Good story built on facts I was unaware of. I recommend story to anyone interested in crime stories and fact based movies.
Good drama.  Keeps you on the edge of your seat.  Sad to know this was based on a real life killer.  Recommended!

I did not appreciate the nudity at all, but I liked the plot and that they caught the guy. I really hate it when things cannot be presented in a way where you know what happened but do not have to SEE it. I have no desire to see naked women, and yet it will be etched in my subconscious anyways. Also, I do not have the body of those women and I am glad I did not see this with my husband. He does not need to see other women naked. I am the only one he should see that way.
All three main characters do an excellent job and make the movie.  No action required, thin story line though for a true story
It is intense and suspenseful. Being a true story adds to the realism albeit somewhat embellished (for screen). The actors do an excellent job.

I liked this movie, but it is not as suspenseful as Insomnia with Al Pacino which also takes place in Alaska.  Strong performances by Nicholas Cage and John Cusack.  Very surprised by Vanessa Hudgens--good job!  If you're a Breaking Bad fan you'll be happy to see Dean Norris (Hank) in the movie playing the part of a cop--he is great in his part and should have been featured more.  Downside is Nicholas Cage's wife and daughter.  Absolutely no character development so what was the point of having them in so many scenes?  It would have been better if the wife and daughter were on a trip to the lower 48 and checked in once or twice on the phone--could have used them to let Cage think out loud and there wouldn't have been any need to feature them very much.

I like most every movie that Nicolas Cage is in and enjoyed this this one too. Funny, I never thought of AK having a serial killer! Many years ago I lived near Fairbanks, for about a year. I enjoyed my stay but happy to get back to a winter with more sun!!

True story. Both my husband and I thought Nicholas Cage did a great job of portraying the actual state trooper and his commitment to bringing this serial killer of women to justice. Rather frightening, but satisfying to know that these men are so dedicated under such difficult circumstances.
Nicholas Cage is always great when he is in a movie and this was a very good movie that kept you guessing!

This is a very good, well acted movie. I had never heard of it until browsing amazon prime. Matter of fact, I had never heard of Bob Hanson the serial killer before. I am glad to see by other reviews that it was true to the real life story. Most movies stray from the original story so much that they are not true any more. Would recommend to watch...
i can"t believe n. cage chose such lame, boring movie to make. it was said to be a real life tale, but they sure made a mess of telling it.
One of Cage's better performances. Good tension throughout the film. John C. played an excellent villain. This film will keep your interest.
Not a thriller at all but it does give insight to the tragedy of those who lost their lives. RIP
I enjoyed the movie and felt it was done well. Nicolas Cage as usual doe his thing and gets the movie going.
My family didn't like the move. Build up was too slow to maintain our interest. We don't recommend this movie unless you want to take a nap before it takes off.
Love Nicolas Cage and he again shows intensity in his character and follow through on the plot.  Although we knew who it was, the getting to the end was good.

Nicolas Cage does it again in a suspense filled drama. He relentlessly pursues a serial killer while showing a very human side to his victims. This is what Nicolas does best. I was thoroughly entertained by this suspenseful movie.
This was an outstanding movie .. Nicolas Cage is such a good actor If you really would like to watch something that will keep you watching this is the movie
We enjoyed the story and acting in Frozen Ground, however at times it was a little slow. It is based on a true story.
These two together plus a good plot made for a good watch! Liked it more than staring at the sun and going blind.
I thought that it was well acted. Yet, it's hard to believe someone would do that to someone else....disturbing and sad.

Watched this on a split second decision, the write up sounded good. I was pleasantly surprised! The true story aspect was also appealing, (though disturbing). It keeps you guessing as to what is going to happen next. The twist at the end is pretty cool as well. A good movie to watch when you're looking for some mystery and suspense.

Interesting concept. A little different than other Nicholas Cage movies I have seen, but still good to watch.

Law and Order would have same episodes in a shorter version.
It is a way better than what the trailer shows. I have never seen a bad movie with Nicolas Cage.
Keeps you going! This is not a movie that I would buy are probably watch again but it was good!
This was one of the best movies I've seen in a very long time. I've recommended this movie to all my friends and all of them have agreed with me!
Good rendition of a true story. Good performances by Cage and Cusak; thrilling and suspenseful. Well worth your viewing time.

Cage was not the typical Cage... this was a plus. He did a great job depicting the ASP Trooper. Cusack and the rest of the cast did a great job telling this story of the predatory monster that ran loose, for way too long, in Alaska. It tells the brunt of the true story. Enough that you won't wonder about much. Watch it and you won't be disappointed.

The movie tells the story of a determined police officer and his uncovering of a serial killer. A good movie that is based on a true story. If you like crime stories, dramas or suspense then this movie is worth a watch. If you're a Nicolas Cage or John Cusack fan then you have to see this.
This film was based on a true story. It had a dark storyline, but it held our interest. Since it involves strippers and prostitutes, there is some nudity.
It didn't make you think through as everything was clear from the beginning but still a good story to watch.

I like "based on a true story" sometimes they can be very disappointing though. This one isn't. Serial killer in Alaska, one of his victims gets away, she is a prostitute and he is well known around the community, family, business etc. So much area in Alaska to dispose of victims and there is the story. The actors....Bravo to all! Vanessa Hudgens, the one the got away is terrific, afraid but brave. John Kusack...must be fun to play the bad guy, he did is so well. And yep, Nicholas Cage as the cop trying to get him in a low key but intense performance.

This was filmed here in our area... about a local murderer that lives in prison around here...  i liked watching it, i saw them filming it out by my mom's house and i thought it must be a band of traveling campers living in Del Roi's parking lot... then i saw them in Anchorage living by Muldoon Baptist Church... i think i saw them filming on top of the parking garage on C Street and 4th avenue too...  great show by the way !
I'm a big fan of John Cusak and he does not disappoint in this movie. Hard to imagine this is based on true events.
Its an entertaining thriller with some good performances. Though it is rather generic as far police thrillers go it is still an enjoyable film.

The Frozen Ground was a really, really good movie.  Based on real life it's dark, highly charged keep me glued.  I think John Cusack was great.  I really like him and it was very hard to look at his face and think him capable.  Nicholas Cage was fantastic.  I'd recommend this movie...but don't watch it alone.

Not a bad movie to fill up a couple hours of your time...Nicolas Cage is his typical self, nothing special and the supporting actors could have been better. Having retired from Law Enforcement and a graduate of the FBI academy, I know there a number of mass murderers out there running around at any given time so the concept that this guy got away with this for a number of years is very believable.
This movie is very intense.  I hadn't even heard about it until it was on prime.  Great movie, my husband and I really liked.
Worth watching, a tad predictable.....solid acting performances. Based on true story which was incredibly scary. I would recommend anyone to watch. John C. was super
I enjoyed the movie, it was suspenseful!  It was very entertaining.  My kind of movie.  Great acting and spectacular scenery.
This is a solid drama based on real-life events.  The acting is excellent.  The characters are one dimensional. Classic evil versus good.

Nicholas Cage can be hit or miss with his acting skills.
He was realistic in the film as a law enforcement official.
Since the movie is based on factual events definitely worthwhile to watch.

True stories always will continue to be more fascinating than fiction or sci-fi.  Only the human mind can put
into action the reality of a twisted and abnormal life of our fellow homo-sapians'.
I can't remember the last time I saw Nick Cage in a movie that didn't suck. This wasn't great, but a decent formula cop thing.

It was weird to know nothing about a movie before watching.  I didn't know it was a real story.
Big name actors!  Wow!
Moderately entertaining, well-acted, but missing the visceral impact to make it stand out. Who knew Alaska was such a hellhole?
Can't even believe this was based a true story, and John Cusack is amazing as the Serial Killer and Vanessa is almost unrecognizable, and just great work from  her.
Unexpected good one. True Story. Great roles for both actors, kept me on the edge of my seat. Adult viewing only.
ending was very good - it was hard to stay with the movie due to the setting; but it was true story so how are you going to avoid it ? would recommend for anyone over 18.
I first, I though it was gong to be a regular cop movie, but it end it up being full of suspense with a twist at the end.
True story made well. Makes one appreciate the value of how much difference ONE person can make! For the good, or the bad.

This is a typical serial criminal show but has an extra kick as it  is based on true facts.  Really a sad case for the victims and their families but the movie was exciting and kept my attention.  I would recommend it even though it won't win any awards.
Excellnt movie with well- -developed plot. Great casting and a suspensful movie and I thoroughly enjoyed it. I would highly recommend it.
Nic Cage & John Cusiak were fantastic, really liked this movie. Being that it was based on a true story made it sad at the same time.
Not bad and keeps you interested but very predictable, good for 1.5h.  Once again typical Nicolas Cage and John Cusack acting.
Always enjoy his movies and this one did not disappoint.  If you like mystery/thrillers, this would be a good choice.
Love Cage anyway and nice to see him in this realistic type of movie again. Movie holds your attention the whole time.
Nicolas Cage gives a great performance and John Cusack fits perfectly on the role of serial killer. I enjoyed the movie and recommend it to people who like suspense and thriller type of movies.

This movie definitely keeps you on the edge of your seat. Fast paced and well done. The only down side to this was that it was based on a true story. I watched it and then watched it again with my husband.
Story was told very poorly it felt like the movie was 4 hours long I kept waiting for the movie to start being good but it never did
Hard to believe a person can be so evil but still be protected acting was good I feel for the families of those girls
Great thriller with good story.  Good acting from Nicholas Cage and John Cusak. Picture not suggested for children due to nudity and some language.
Not profound but solid acting and good script.  I Would watch it again.  Not exact, but close to many facts of the case.
It was an ok movie. Not really something I'd want to watch again. I would probably not recommend this movie to my friends.

I am a huge fan of Nicholas Cage and that is why I watched the whole movie otherwise, it was so dark I felt like leaving it halfway a number of times. It was based on a real life serial killer Robert Hansen, played by John Cusack. I'm not a huge fan of typecasting but still it was hard to see John Cusack in a negative role as he was clearly uncomfortable with it. The plot is simple - Robert Hansen is a mild, stuttering man who is well-liked in his neighborhood but Sergeant Jack Halcombe played by Nicholas Cage and his team know that he is a serial killer and try really hard to find evidence to convict him with the help of Cindy Paulson, one of the victims of Robert Hansen who escaped.

If you have the stomach for dark movies, then do go ahead and watch - excellent acting by Nicholas Cage and Vanessa Hudgens who plays Cindy Paulson.
This is a great movie.  It's based on true events which made it even more exciting for me.  I would highly recommend this movie to anyone who is interested in suspense.
Been there done that, got the t-shirt. Not a horrible movie but not a gripping thriller either. That said, I used to live in Alaska and the local connection is why I watched it.
This was a great thriller built from a true story.  The actors were perfect for the roles and the plot kept the action timely and interesting.
I didn't think i would have watch it completely but it was pretty interesting how it all went down at the end.
I like Nicolas Cage, so I selected the movie.  Then I was pleasantly surprised with John Cusak's role.  The story itself was a bit predicable.
Good story, edge of the seat at times.  John Cusack plays the role of a killer really very well.  Sick SOB.

This is a story about a brave young woman, and a couple good police officers who risked their jobs to do the right thing. Plenty of action, suspense, and good plot. This is a well done movie, with great actors.
Suspenseful. Plot-driven. Well done. The actors may not be as good as Tom Hanks, but this movie showcases their talents -- other than their love-sappy, adventure seeking background.
Good thriller about about a psychopath in Alaska. Cusack and Cage both did great jobs. Can't believe it is based on true events. Worth watching.
good thriller movie , nice video quality, good sound quality and over all its good movie to watch with family
I did not realize until the end that it was based on a true story. It is a movie well worth watching.
This movie has a great cast, it was fast moving, kept my attention the whole time, very good.  Definitely recommend it.

Passably done and moderately interesting, possibly because it takes place in a "new" place to me for movies: Anchorage. It's worth a couple hours of your time if you have Amazon Prime, but you can probably find better films to watch for the price of a rental.
Usually I like Nicholas Cage movies, but not this one. Can't say that I recommend it though others liked it.
This was an ok movie, but was made better because it was a true story. The acting was fine...even though it had Nick Cage in it. :-)
The only factor that keeps this from being a five-star crime thriller is the pacing.  A slightly shorter, faster-paced version would have been excellent.
Great actors and based on a true story which makes it even more interesting to watch. I would highly recommend this film.
They could have done it without it.  It would have retained the content of the story. Its boring at times
Basically, this is a good vs evil movie. We wanted to stick with it to see good win, but the evil is too disturbing. We had to turn it off 1/3 of the way in.

Good movie. Well worth watching on TV. Not worth paying for at the movie theatre.
It is hard to believe that there are people in our society that are as sick and deminted as this man was.

Movie does tell us we need to listen to and care for victims instead of treating them like they did somethingwrong because of who they are. We need more caring, decent people like the character Nicholas Cage played.

Loved this story. I really liked the heroine, she was so tormented but so brave.  And I don't usually like Nicholas Cage, but he really worked the story well, and I enjoyed him in his role.  Loved the Alaska shots.
Thriller. Best movie I have seen in a long time. You will not be disappointed. Nicholas Cage is awesome. Based on a true story.
John Cusack can be a really scary character and Cage didn't over act in this movie. Better than I thought it would be.

I live in Alaska and a lot of Alaskans, myself, included were not happy with the making of this film. After watching it though, I think they did a good job in humanizing the victims as people rather than as just sex workers. I had to skip through a few scenes but, overall it wasn't in bad taste and did not glorify the murderer like some types of movies do. It also showed how brave the survivor is that helped put him away. Eklutna Annie is something that has always haunted me since I heard about these murders. She has still not been identified some 30 years later and is buried in a graveyard in downtown Anchorage.

I have to give props to this film's producers: they actually filmed this story where it happened, in Anchorage, AK and the surrounding area.  I recognized all of the landmarks and the Knik River Valley where this monster buried his victims. I remember the story well.

My only nitpicks were:
1.  The streets of Anchorage were far too crowded.  That just doesn't happen there unless something like the Iditarod start is going on.  The strip clubs are all too real and they did huge business during the oil pipeline ramp-up, but foot traffic is almost never heavy.
2.  Nick Cage kept saying "KINNick River".  It's pronounced more like k'NIK.
3.  The central witness, a survivor of the psychopath, is shown talking to the cops over a handheld cellphone.  In 1983.  Not a chance.

Despite its editing choppiness, the film tells the story pretty well.  Cusack does his usual excellent job and Cage keeps the emoting to a minimum.
I thought the acting was very good and the plot held your attention. The fact it was based on a true story shows you how sick and evil some members of society are.

This has to be one of  the worst films on a horrible subject (which, while it can and should be the subject of a film, needed to be treated with dignity, respect and care) which wasted the talents of excellent actors. The writing and directing were basic at best, rather like a high school play with wooden actors going through the motions the best they could with the material provided.
The best use of this film is as a demonstration in filmic writing classes to demonstrate what not to do--ever.
It took all my energy to restrain myself from finding a pencil and stabbing myself in the eye while watching this cinematic disaster.
At the very beginning, the audience already knows who is the killer and this is the major problem for the movie.

The movie was very scary and entertaining at the same time. I remember reading about this serial killer and there was also a documentary on television about him. Wow a serial killer in Alaska. Talk about prime real estate to hide bodies. To think that this really happened makes it even scarier. The acting was great and credible. This is a must see.
Enjoyed ever bit of this show, the drama tha suspense. I feel horrible for tha folks that really had to thru this.
As usually, not always though, Nicholas Cage did an excellent job on this movie.  It was not a comedy nor was it anything but a drama that is more real than reality sometimes

Don't go in thinking that you will know what is going to happen. I know that there are a lot of bad Independent films out there with Nicholas Cage in them. Frozen Ground is not one of them. This is a good movie, it is suspenseful and has a good plot. The only downfall about this movie is that it is based on a true story.

I watched it about half way through which was enough time to figure out the simple plot.  The actors never evolved from their initial introduction. John Cusack never fit the bill as a serial killer he would have played a child molester part better and Nicolas Cage is still too autocratic.
The acting was very good and the story was filmed very good.  Things like that does happen and we aren't aware of it.
acting was great kept you on your seat, I would recommend to everyone who likes true stories It was great~!
I really enjoyed this movie. What's better is that I had no idea it was a true story! I really got into the story and characters.
It was hard to see a lot of the scenes.  Not sure if it was because of the movie of what!
Awesome. Gripping.  Starts off slow, but you get hooked and can't stop watching.  Great acting!  Nicholas Cage and John Cusack are great!
Both Cage and Cousak played their roles great. I had never heard of this story until recently. Glad I watched it.
Suspenseful.  John Cusack is the ultimate actor and excels in anything he does.  The other actors also played their parts well.
John cusack was great, nick cage well he was normal nick cage. Pretty crazy that people like the psycho really exist.
This was a hard movie to get into the was a lot of cruelty and hard hitting drama in the beginning. It was very realistic . You were glad to see how the ending turned out. Very good over all.
Well made true story! Kept you on the edge of your seat from the beginning to the end. Cage was great as he always is in his movies
I think John Cusack did a good playing the villian, I can't think of another time where he has played one.  Gritty film, suspenseful
What a tiresome offering from Nick Cage!  Money talks when your near retirement! Put this on your non-wish list or as a gift for someone on your hate list.
Wooow its one heck of a thriller....I lykd d acting of Nichols cage as usual n d screenplay....great movie.  Woooow.
Boring, too slow, I did not finish watch whole picture. I would not pass on to my friends.  Nicolas Cage is my favorite actor.

we saw the news story on this.
glad they made it about the women. not him.
hope they find more to help families move on.

I was trying to watch this with my 80 year old mother and hubbie.  Hubbie left the room in embarrassment.  Mom and I tried to watch but it really dragged for us and we finally left without finishing it.

I understood what was going on, but it seemed like there were gaps in the collection of evidence or the connections were lacking.  Anyway, I like a good crime drama, and this one had 2 good actors, but the story line was lacking.

I liked it, but Nick Cage is a favorite of mine. Offers a disturbing look at the life of sex workers, abused kids that run away and nobody cares, fodder for just the kind of life pimps, pornographers and disturbed men want them for. They will never know for sure how many this guy killed, Alaska was and is and attractant to people like this because of its vast territory, under manned police, and seeming like they can't get caught. But then again similar things happen in the lower 48 too. Lot of sick minds out there.

i lived very near where this happened, very frightening how many wackos are out there.  Our parents always taught us to go in groups and scream and yell if we were approached.  i feel bad for those girls that did not have anyone and had to resort to life in the streets to survive.
This movie is a true story and will have you on the edge of your seat through out the whole length of the film.

Did we really need to make a film about this guy? Do we really need to see women abused in this way? It does not serve the public the way a holocaust documentary does. It made me feel ill and slimy watching it.
The movie was interesting. If you like crime drama's and stories about serial killers. I am a big Cusack fan. Sad story with a positive end. Did not realize it was a true story until the end.

While I love anything Nicolas Cage is in, this movie really tripped me out! I love movies like this, but I was seriously impressed with the other performances as well. The cast does more and convinces me more then many other movies. And this time Nicolas Cage does not stand alone!
This movie proved to be suspenseful and had you guessing how they would catch the suspect.  A slight amount of unnecessary nudity.
I remember watching about the real guy on ID or one of the shows.  It is a good job of retelling the story I guess.  If you are bored this is a good filler of time but not a must see.
Kind of boring. Both Cusack and Cage were pretty good but story not so good and not so believable. More suited to a tv 1 hour show. Sorry I paid to see that mess.
This is one of the great movies that's based on a true story, aside from the storyline, you get an opportunity to see the beautiful mountain range of Alaska.

This is a realistic look at police work in the seedy side of an Alaskan town. Nicolas Cage gave an excellent, understated performance. His work is the best I've seen him do. John Cusack plays a serial killer with depth and realism. As the heavy, Cusack shows us the complicated character of the killer without asking for our sympathy. The outside scenes in the wilderness and the inner city were very interesting. I recommend the movie to anyone who meets the R rating cautions.
The movie has several scenes of nudity and sex that some viewers will find objectionable. I would restrict the viewing of this movie to adults at least 18 years old.

I'd never heard of this movie before I was it on Amazon prime.  It was sell done and gave a look at he Alaska we never see.  Most movies about Alaska emphasize the unspoiled wilderness and beauty of the state.  This film took place in Anchorage and showed the strip clubs and bars and prostitution.  The film centered on a prostitute who got away from a serial killer, a state trooper who believed her story and the serial killer.  John Cusack did an excellent job portraying a man who could be your next door neighbor but stalked and killed women.  The fact that this is a true story made it all the more thrilling.  The movie really didn't drag anywhere.  The only negative could be that there was little of the human side showing the character's love interests.  The trooper and the serial kilelr were both married with children but you saw little of their family drama. That doesn't bother me but some viewers may fine it more like a docudrama than an entertaining movie.  There was some brief nudity in the bar scenes but this is not a kid's movie.
Great movie.  Great suspense, good acting and appears to have stayed true to the facts.  I'm surprised that the movie isn't more well known but I suspect that the dark subject matter doesn't help.
Well acted ensemble cast. A great and true example of police work at its finest. Destined to be a crime classic!
Very good movie.  I would recommend it. Not a Nicholas cage fan but he did a good job and played a good actor in this movie.

I love Nicholas Cage and John Cusac, so I will watch anything they're in.  This movie kept my interest the whole way through!  The fact that it's based on actual accounts made it that more intriguing.

very good acting and suspenseful throughout the whole movie.
while you knew who the killer was from the beginning you still were kept entertained.
Usually love anything by Nicholas cage but this was a movie he should never had done.  Slow. Bad acting by all

This is a hard movie to watch because it's so real. It's based on a true story about a serial killer of women. The dark light of Alaska, the tough faces of the actors, the people making bad choices and suffering terrible outcomes... But that's the way reality is. Everyone did a good job.
Cusack did a great job. Cage and Cusack are on my favorite actors list. Based on a true story. I recommend.
Grisly tale, but really enjoyed watching the drama.  Lots of plot twists, and Cage and Cusack were excellent in their roles.  We enjoyed it.

First of all I thought I had made a big mistake watching the movie, as it is based on fact I thought it maybe a docudrama, it is not. It is well acted and I am a fan of Nicholas Cage ( not all of his movies but most of them. Did I enjoy yes I did. Recommend it I gave it 3 stars that says enough and I was kind
Recommended highly. Spellbinding.  Wow, another great N. Cage movie. You better have your drink and popcorn ready before you start watching.

I prefer movies based on true facts; so The Frozen Ground was right up my alley. Nicholas Cage is one of my favorite actors and he did not let me down in this movie. At times, the movie appeared a bit slow, but that is consistent with true-life films. How frustrating it must have been for the authorities attempting to solve these heinous murders. One can only empathize with the families of the missing and murdered girls. Oh, what a difference DNA testing has made. I definitely recommend this movie for those who like true serial killer genre films.
Pretty good Nicholas Cage movie.  I was pleasantly surprised for a movie that I wasn't expecting much from.  Worth a watch!

I really like Nicolas Cage and usually enjoy the roles he plays.  However, I don't understand why so much bad language has to be in from the start.  We probably didn't watch for 5 minutes until we turned it off and went to something else.  There ARE decent people still left that don't like hearing the English language butchered.  It does nothing for the story line to include cursing and needless four-letter words.
3.5 kind of drags at times, not one of cages best , great scenery , based on true story recommend

Nicholas Cage and John Cusack were very convincing in their roles. Cage came across as determined, perhaps even a bit obsessed, while Cusack was, until his last scene, quietly chilling.  Here's a plus !!!. There is an actual story !
Good acting, captivating story line, based on true story, One of Nicholas Cage's more compelling roles. Sure to hold your interest all the way through.

it was an ok movie just slow seems like things were in it  just to be in the movie.
but it was somewhat interesting.
I enjoyed the story. Not one I was familiar with. Made me want to read up on real case. Dramatized quite a bit from real story but was pretty well acted. No crazy Nic Cage. "=_
Loved it! Had a great story line and suspense. I liked that it was based on true events. Makes it more exciting. I plan on watching it again!

Although very sad, it was enlightening as to how this could happen and it appears not much real caring or attention by law enforcement until Nicholas Cage's character get involved. It also demonstrates the real need for DNA testing and all the advances in technology that would have helped back then I think, e.g. as in Forensic Files.

I always like watching true stories.  This
was very well done and it was amazing
the story was kept quiet by the victim so long.....tragic!
You will be on the edge of your seat waiting for the plot to develop and still not be ready for what happens.

This movie was based on a true story.  It's hard to say you like something when the subject is so dark and horrifying, but it was well done  The actors did their usual credible best.  I actually went online to read the actual story after I read the book so it's safe to say I found it intriguing that one person can be two such opposite personalities.
Nicholas Cage is such an engaging actor.  Although the plot was not particularly unique, it kept your attention throughout.  Entertaining
A nicely down movie based on a book I believe  of true events in Alaska.  Some strong language and graphic scenes.

Two great actors, a "based on true events" story, and beautifully filmed on-site locales in Alaska. We learn the ID of the perp early on but he proves to be an adept prey as well as an expert hunter. He used his devious talents to fool a whole town. It makes the local PD force look somewhat above incompetent for blindly assuming such a nice guy could be a serial killer. Of all people, serials generally appear normal to the average person, that's how they walk among us.

I looked up Butcher Baker online, and there are a few blogs and comments from people who actually knew him, bought bread from him and  never suspected a thing. Thank god for that one cop in the station that secretly went against the common thinking and sent the case file up the ladder to outside office of FBI, and how lucky that the survivor teenager finally reluctantly agreed to help, or this would have been an unsolved murder once the perp got too old. Hope this is not a spoiler for anyone

This movie is based on a true story that happened in the 80's.  Nicolas Cage, who sometimes seems to overact to me, is very good in this movie.  John Cusak  does an excellent job in his role.  It was much better than I expected as I don't recall reading about this movie as a theater release.
Extremely disturbing for a woman to watch. Had to stop watching because of the storyline. Not usually bothered by movies but found this one to be disturbing.

Based on a true story, Cage and Cusack go head to head as an investigator and serial killer.  Cusack is creepy and believable as a serial rapist. Cage is, well Cage.  Director gets in the way of a decent story with way too much shaky camera and overacting in the supporting cast.  Who knew Alaska could be so seedy?
I really enjoyed watching this movie. It is based on a true story and was done very well. It keeps you interested throughout the whole movie. Great for family nights or couples night!

this got a five star rating because it was a fantastic drama.  So awful that is a  true life story. Cage exceptional. Hudgens excellent. Cusack always incredibly believable. 3 fabulous actors. This movie is based on a true story of a sick individual. This is not a movie for children to watch or even be in earshot of. I didn't hate the movie but I would never consider buying anything with this much language issues. It could have been done with less shock value.  I am disappointed in myself for not stopping the movie when I realized how much profanity they crammed into a mediocre film. The movie focused on the survivor of a serial killer but I think it would have been better if they gave a little more background to the trooper (Cage) for example, his wife switching from not supporting his efforts in the case to encouragement. If you want to be inundated with obscenities and watch naked people prance across the screen this is for you but if you want to be entertained pick another flick.

Overall great flick good suspense. Highly recommended.

Serial killer stories tend to fascinate me, so I tend to cut them some slack.

Oh, and there might be a spoiler or two in here ... but I'm not telling anything you don't learn in the first 5 minutes or so of the film. Certainly nothing important.

This one was decent. Being based on a true story, I'm guessing they were sticking to historical accuracy, but I thought the story could have been a bit stronger. There was superfluous stuff about Cage's character that I thought just muddied the story. And I don't think they did a good enough job at the start of portraying Cusack as the image of an up-standing, law-abiding citizen. Frankly, one look at him in the film screamed "serial killer!"

All in all, it's worth watching if you like serial killer "documentaries".
A murder mystery much like "The Killing," except you learn who the killer is before the end.  A good movie.

Both Cage and Cusack gave wonderful performances and it was a first new role for both.  Cage was serious and realistic and Cusack portrays an excellent bad guy.  Justice for the victim was realized despite the reluctance of the system.

The movie was tightly woven and the characters were extremely well portrayed.  It was difficult adjusting to John Cusack as a bad guy, but he was terrific in his role.  Cage was once again, a superb actor in a role similar to others he has played.

A true story adapted for film, the heroine had so many faults it was initially hard to care whether she survived.  But, Cage's dedication to solving a string of serial murders involving her caused us to hope the girl survived her ordeal of kidapping, rape, and torture and all would end well for her.  She is a young prostitute, hooked on many different drugs, and trusts no one...until at the end she trusts Cage and his other police fellows.

The only fault I found with the film is the darkness.  And, I don't mean the storyline, I mean the film was mostly shot in the dark, in crowds, chasing around.  It made it hard to follow at times, and we did a lot of rewinding to find out what had happened and what was said.

All in all, however, I would recommend this movie for those who like murder, police stories, and adventure.

Nicholas Cage has made some messy films, but 'The Frozen Ground' is an excellent film. What we see is the nitty gritty of a real investigation. After the downtown Alaska Police closed the files of several girls gone missing, Nicholas Cage's detective takes on the cases and discovers at least seven missing women which climbs to 17 and possibly 30.

Robert Hansen, played brilliantly by John Cusack, a mild mannered man who lived in Anchorage with his wife and children, is a serial killer. It takes many months, grueling hours and fighting the justice system for Cage's detective to bring him down. This is his story. Vanessa Hudgen plays a young 17 year old on her own, trying to make her way by selling her body for money. She had a very difficult childhood and ended up in Alaska. She was a victim of Robert Hansen, but she got away. The downtown Alaskan Police did not believe her because of her professional life. That is what these women were up against. The throw away women of our society. However, there were good policemen who wanted to serve their population, and this is also their story.  The gritty night life is portrayed in all it's ugliness and the black and white film brings it to the fore.

Recommended. prisrob 05-26-14

Nicolas Cage and John Cusack deliver tour de force performances in the story of an Alaskan serial killer during the 1980s. Both Cage and Cusack are brilliant in their roles as the dogged pursuer and the disturbed, calculating suspect.  While I cringe every time I see the victimization of women onscreen, thankfully The Frozen Ground kept the grim, torturous details to a minimum, instead concentrating on the cat-and-mouse relationship between the steely, driven Cage and the demented Cusack.

As a solid police procedural, this drama worked on several levels with believability and realism heightened by the Alaska location filming.  A fine look at the frustrations inherent in investigative police work pre-widespread computers and the internet.  A definite return to form for Cage, and yet another amazingly insightful job by Cusack.
Nicolas Cage movies are always good!  I was glued to my seat pleanty of suspense. John Cusack also played a part that you just wanted him  to get caught.

What a great movie! Nicholas Cage is a detective in Alaska who is about to retire. His last case is a abduction/murder case. Vanessa Hudgens plays a exotic dancer/prostitute abducted and tortured by John Cusack, but escapes. The rest of the movie consists of detectives trying to prove their case against this killer who may have killed many more women. Very suspenseful and taut action scenes meshed with the splendor of Alaskan wilderness. Vanessa Hudgens is truly remarkable as "Cindy", a teenage runaway, who lives in the seedy underworld of Alaska's strip clubs and prostitution circles. She absolutely shines as Cindy. Cindy is a lost soul who has no one in her corner until Nicholas Cage's character befriends her. This former Disney star has some real acting skills. She is gonna be a star that everyone will remember. I loved this movie! Beautiful scenery and camera work. Very good casting. Excellent acting and direction. Watch it and enjoy it!

I LOVE ANYTHING NICHOLAS CAGE DOES- I WISH HE HAD BEEN IN X-MEN AND SOME OTHER COMIC HERO ROLES.  His open 'pain' never fails to deliver a tear from me- I RELATE TO 'his brooding, charismatic, and wounded portrayals AND DESPITE HIS TURNS AS A VILLAIN/PSYCHO- He exemplifies for me the phrasing of Mick JAGGER'S 'SYMPATHY FOR THE DEVIL'/GIMME SHELTER.  THIS IS ANOTHER 'piece d'resistance' in HIS ONEROUS PLAYBOOK.

Though this movie is about a true serial killer, one who was killing around the same time as the Green River Killer, just in Alaska, it's more a telling of the life of Cindy Paulson, and her horrifying experience.  I first read about Hansen in a John Douglas book (frankly, I can't remember if it was in MindHunter or Journey Into Darkness, but it was one of them), and had always thought of Paulson as the real hero of the story.  After all, this girl managed to get away from a serial killer who'd dispatched MANY MANY victims before her.  If there's any name you should remember, it should be that of Cindy Paulson.  After being kidnapped, raped, and truly would have been dead if she didn't run half naked down an Alaska road until someone picked her up and took her to the police station.  I always thought it a travesty she wasn't believed and was treated like dirt by the local police, and as the story shows, only after someone really looked into things did they realize the disgrace and injustice of the local legal system at the time.

Again, as someone whose known this story for 2 decades, I was a little suspicious I hadn't heard of the film, especially when it brings A listers like Cusack and Cage to it.  As others have stated, I'm thrilled they didn't glorify the killer, or turn it into a slasher flick, but rather told us Paulson's side of the story, with the truth of what happened to so many other women at the hands of a monster.  I watched it because I knew the back story... One thing they left out was one of the witnesses who said Hansen had been at his house playing cards the night of Paulson's rape later came forward and admitted he'd been asked by Hansen to lie, though Hansen had lied to the guy about with what crime he'd been a suspect, and I think that would have helped others KNOW they had the right guy.  I thought they left a small bit of doubt in the actual police case against Hansen, when in truth they had him dead to rights.

Anyway, despite watching it because I felt I knew the story, I actually found myself caught up in the film which is true testimony to the job done by the writers, actors, director, and producers.  If you enjoy true crime tales, This is absolutely worth the time.

This is the story of Robert Hanson, a serial killer in Alaska that murdered a lot of female prostitutes.  He would keep them captive and force them to have sex for days (he offered them money but never paid them) and then would kill them.  The title was for how he left them on the ice and in the snow where they were not found for a long time.  He was a well known businessman who ran a bakery that many people.  The book I read was "Butcher / Baker" which describes him perfectly.  But he was a cold hearted sociopath that believed these women to be trash, beneath him, and not deserving of life.  He was convicted and sent to prison for life.  In the movie, Nicholas Cage plays the cop who chases him down.  This cop was supposed to retire in two weeks at the time that he got this case and most of the other cops dismissed the case because the women were hookers and their suspect was a respected businessman.  But this cop, the one played by Cage, was moved by the case and pursued it until an arrest was made.  Great story, great acting, true to the book as I recall it.  Loved it and recommend it to true crime fans and Nicholas Cage fans as well.  This is one of his better acting jobs.

This movie was very disappointing. I am surprised that John Cusak is in it, but not surprised Cage is in it. This movie was not believable, and was over the top with what it showed of one man's cruelty towards human beings. It was not worth watching.

Must admit that I had never heard of this movie.  I was home alone & bored when I was searching for something to watch.  Accidentally ran into it on Prime Instant & decided to give it a try because I'm a fan of both Nicolas Cage & John Cusack.  It starts out slow & moves along slow.  I started to turn it off.  Then I realized 30 minutes later that I was still watching.  Not even sure why but it just kept drawing me in.  The intensity began to increase & I needed to know how it ended.  Although I'm usually pretty good at guessing the endings to most movies, I wanted to see how this one played out on its own.  Yes, the setup of this movie was slow & detailed; but that made the ending twice as much fun!!!  What I hadn't realized was that this is a true event that occurred from 1973-1983.  That made the whole thing a lot more interesting!!!  By the end of this movie, I was emailing my friends & family to be sure to watch this one when they got the chance!!!  It's one of those movies that you're not sure you like until it comes full circle at the end & the way it is drawn together makes the WHOLE thing worth it!!!  All in all I am NOT sorry I watched this movie!!!  Honestly, I probably won't watch it again when alone & definitely would NOT buy the DVD.  Still it was well worth my time watching it on streaming; & IF in the right mood, I would not hesitate to share it with a visiting friend.  I just wouldn't want it sitting around collecting dust!!!  Not sure it deserves 5 stars; yet it was much better than 4 stars!!!

Nicolas Cage portrays an Alaska State Trooper who wears a tie and sees beyond what is obvious to piece together the puzzle of deaths Mr. Robert Hansen has committed.  He uses wit and sly tactics to outsmart the perpetrator when the system doesn't work well.

Actress Vanessa Hudgens portrays Cindy Paulson who helps Jack Halcombe (Nicolas Cage) track down Robert Hansen who is portrayed by John Cusack.  Vanessa's Native American descent and looks gives the role realism and believability.  Her back street vernacular brings street creed to her role as a stripper and prostitute.

I love Nicholas Cage.  And I really like John Cusack. I think they're both good, solid actors (Cage being amazing) and I usually look forward to their movies. This one really just didn't do it for me, though. It's not bad, it's just that I know they both can do much better work. I was disappointed. Maybe it was because they identifed the killer too soon, eliminating the suspense. Maybe it was because neither of them seemed very excited about the story itself. Maybe it was because their only surviving witness, who could help them solve the murders, wasn't as terrified as I'd expect her to be (although she certainly wasn't "calm" about the whole thing). All in all, this one's OK for a Saturday popcorn night if you're doing something else at the same time and don't need to watch every scene. Other than that, bleh. This one and "my" guys let me down.

I enjoyed this movie. It told a very interesting true story about the pursuit of a serial killer in Alaska. It was well acted by Nicolas Cage, John Cusack and (a newcomer to me) Vanessa Hudgens. I highly recommend this movie.

This movie is so good, so much better than almost everything else in this genre (true crime), it's hard to believe it has not gotten more attention. Nic Cage is passionate in an understated, professional way, just as we like to think real cops would be in this horrific situation. I can't describe the shocking nature of some scenes without spoiling it, but, no, I'm not referring to the topless bar or the sex scenes. Those are part of the underside of Anchorage where the serial killer hunts and, if anything, the very banality of the day-to-day life of the killer and, yes, the ordinariness of the killer himself are the most frightening things. The excellent reviews by those who knew the killer in real life reinforce this (which is even more horrifying). They say this guy was ordinary, a part of life in Anchorage, but it was only his disguise. The casting of marvelous talent for the roles of the young victims and the other young women who help them on the streets and in the bars is part of a trend I noticed in the last season of The Killing. I hope Hollywood and the indies continue to promote young talent and, eventually, find some parts for them other than street kids. The quality of the acting in this movie across the board makes me want to find some other streaming gems to watch.

I enjoyed this movie overall. Nic Cage was understated and very believable unlike some of his more recent films. Cusack makes a great creep. I love true crime and this film was very well made. It's a shame it went straight to dvd but well worth watching...

Great movies always get the details right, good movies not so much. Having grown up and spent a lot of time in Anchorage mostly the details were mostly right..........until the car cell phone was introduced into the story line. In 1983 the only cell phones to be had were the size of suitcases and not many civilians had them, and none were the handset type mounted in a car driven by a low level pimp. Not sure what the actual original events were, but get the details right and the storyline gets better and more believable - because the acting and story tension is good in this film.

I find that the best thrillers come from films that are based on real life events. Some of these stories are just so twisted and crazy, that even the best writer wouldn't be able to imagine them on their own. The story told in the film The Frozen Ground, is one such story, telling the world about serial killer, Robert Hansen. From the 1970s until 1983, Hansen was one of the nations most prolific serial killers. What makes Hansen's story unique is that he was able to do all this, without the police even connecting the cases, because of where he lived. Hansen's story begins in Anchorage Alaska, where he began preying on prostitutes. After torturing and killing them, he would dump the bodies in remote, unpopulated areas of Alaska, where they were ravaged by the weather and wild animals. This made finding the cause of death or even identifying the victims nearly impossible. Hansen would probably still be active today, if it wasn't for Cindy Paulson, the only victim in 12 years, to escape the madman, and that's where our film begins. Nicholas Cage stars as Jack Halcombe, a state police detective who comes up with a wild theory that all these missing people and strange deaths, could be connected. Halcombe has a tough time convincing anyone of this, especially since his only witness is a drug abusing prostitute. Nicolas Cage excels in movies like this and is again terrific. Cage was born to play a cop and in my opinion does it better than anyone else out there. In this film, he's paired with Zac Efron's ex, Vanessa Hudgens, who wasn't great, but was much better than I expected. It's difficult to make the transition from Disney cover girl to a legitimate movie star, but I'd say that Hudgens is well on her way. Finally, John Cusack rounds out this all-star cast, playing Robert Hansen. After all the films I've seen Cusack in, I really couldn't imagine him as the bad guy, but his performance is what really helps this movie stand out, and hopefully will lead him to other similar roles. The Frozen Ground is a little slow, but it is supposedly very accurate, and tells an interesting story that most people know nothing about. It's the kind of film that I really go for and hopefully you will too.
Being based on a true story made it one you just couldn't look away from.  We recommend this movie, GREAT.

2014 is already up and running and showing no signs of slowing down. I have not been doing as many reviews as I would definitely like to, but I am consistently working to get better and have more done in time for the summer. Just today, I came across a movie that was not at all familiar to me but one that I enjoyed watching. Lets talk about The Frozen Ground.

In the movie, Cindy Paulson is found in a horrific condition by officers and later questioned by Sergeant Jack Halcombe. Upon learning the details of what has happened to her, Jack and Cindy must work to take down our antagonist Robert Hansen. And so our movie begins.

Like normal, I start with the acting. I must say I was impressed with everyone's acting in the film; especially Vanessa Hudgens's and Joan Cusack's performances. Also great in his role as the lead Officer Jack Halcombe, Nicholas Cage who encompasses the character with resolve and skill.

It is not always the easiest film to watch, but The Frozen Ground is a solid movie for the movie viewer. I rate this movie:

8/10

Rated R

Starring: Nicholas Cage, Vanessa Hudgens, 50 Cent, Joan Cusack, Matt Gerald,

I was expecting quite a gripping story, but found this movie severly lacking in that department. While the acting was ok, and the scenery was beautiful, the story just never seemed able to hold my attention.

This is actually a very good movie, entertaining while trying to be as accurate as they could to this true story (well, as accurate as Hollywood can).  The film was shot entirely in and around Anchorage and shows some of the places where actual events took place (for example Merrill Field, the very busy airport in the heart of town).  The cinematography is quite good although it's difficult to film a bad landscape in Alaska and some of the vistas that are shown, especially during the flying sequences, are stunning.

Really enjoyed the movie and the two principal actors, John Cusack and Nicolas Cage are very good.  Cusack is always consistently good and it's intriguing to see him play the bad guy here.  Cage's performance is (for once) quite reserved and captures the character of the weary Alaska State Trooper very well.  Recommended...

This is based on a true story about an Alaskan serial killer who got away with hunting women for years and the police officer (Nicolas Cage) who finally brought him to justice with the help of the only woman who got away, a prostitute-- whose complaint of kidnapping and rape was discounted by the "good old boys" at the department who said that the "family man" she accused could not have possibly done it, and was called to the attention of the detective investigating the crimes by the one officer who believed that she was telling the truth. The vastness of the wilderness and the fact that the killer flew his own small plane allowed him to distribute the remains of his victims in out-of-the-way areas where they were not likely to be found, and after finally confessing, the killer led the police to the remains of 17 victims as part of his plea deal.
  Be warned, this is an adult movie--there are murders and attempted murders, corpses (fresh,decayed, and/or fed upon by animals), strong language, and nudity (in the strip clubs where the police pursue their investigation).

I bought this film because of Nicholas Cage and John Cusack.  As a thriller, it's ok.  As an adaptation of a true crime - the reality is devastating.  Ironically, I felt that the subject could have been better served if Cage and Cusack weren't in the film.  It could have been a great documentary like Imposter.  Somehow the pacing and styling of the film didn't (as it was intended to) creep me out.  It felt too much like a Hollywood telemovie than a gritty unfolding.

One reason is the cast - we're too conditioned to watching Cage - and Cusack - as stars.  Cusack has invested too much of his career playing nice guys that even now, as a psychopath - he doesn't feel like all that bad a guy.  A lesser known cast might have made this work better and another director.  Still, it's not a bad film, but this is not a David Fincher level film.

I thank the filmmakers for making it happen - and dedicating this to the missing women.

The Frozen Ground is a thriller starring Nicolas Cage and John Cusack that had a very limited theatrical run before being released on DVD and Blu-ray.  The film is based on the true story of serial killer Robert Hansen.  Between 1971 and 1983, Hansen murdered between 17 and 21 women near Anchorage, Alaska. He was convicted in 1983 and is currently serving 461 years in Spring Creek Correctional Center in Seward, Alaska.  Cage plays Alaskan State Police Detective Jack Halcombe (based on real life Detective Glenn Flothe) who only has a couple of weeks left on the job before he is set to start a new position outside of police work.

Halcombe gets assigned the case of an 18 year-old runaway who was allegedly abducted and raped by Hansen.  However her case was never prosecuted due to the lack of evidence.  When a decomposed body turns up whose cause of death is similar to several other unsolved murders, Halcombe begins to investigate several cold case murders and disappearances of young, local women.  Everything points to Hansen, now a prominent local businessmen and Jack has to find the evidence to take down the killer.

The Frozen Ground is a pure connect-the-dot thriller that features solid performances from Cage, Cusack, and especially Vanessa Hudgens as Cindy Paulson, the runaway who escaped Hansens clutches.  The film also features a strong supporting cast including 50 Cent as an Anchorage street pimp, Radha Mitchell as Jacks wife, and Kurt Fuller as the District Attorney.  But despite the strong cast Director Scott Walker is content for the standard cat and mouse game of cop and killer and attempts to add nothing new to make the plot standout.  Weve seen this type of police procedural done much better in other films.  While Cusack bears a creepy likeness to the real life Hansen, he doesnt make him especially terrifying.

I found this to be a great story based on true events. Does it start off slow? Yes, but it becomes great before the halfway point. Additionally, Cusack is incredible, coming off with a hint of Kevin Spacey in his character. Cage is quite redeeming as he plays his role modestly (for the first time in a long time.) I think you'll like it.

John Cusack was amazing as the serial killer Robert Hansen (Hanson?) acting like the typical guy next door who you wouldn't suspect as a killer but underneath his clean cut demeanor is the evil that always leaks out. Both characters are overly obsessed in their own ways, the sergeant with catching and exposing the killer and robert for hunting down these women and murdering them and this film shows how they act out these obsessions very well. I don't mind the stiff cage acting as thats just how he acts and i've become used to it but other then that, a few silly lines here and there and some cliched good cop bad cop moments this was a good thriller. Not one i intend on watching over and over but i'm sure i will watch it again sometime soon.

I had to work as a stripper before, and though it's only a job people look at you like you're lower than dirt. Also, the detective who fought for the girls and the young girl victim who also helped instead of leaving town, a streetwalker who had been violated by relatives as a child and was trying to survive on her own because living with her family was not an option (at least as a sex worker she got paid), were heroes.

THE DOCUMENTARY WAS ACTUALLY MORE GRAPHIC AND THE SERIAL KILLER IN THE STORY HAD A LONG TRACK RECORD OF COMMITTING HEINOUS ACTS WOMEN...TO THIS DAY WE MAY NEVER RECOVER ALL THE BODIES OR KNOW THE TRUE DEATH COUNT.

CAGE AND CUSACK PLAY THEIR PARTS VERY WELL.  I THINK THERE ARE A LOT OF PEOPLE WHO ARE NOT AWARE OF THIS KILLING SPREE THAT WENT ON FOR MANY, MANY YEARS- THANKS TO POOR POLICE WORK AND PEOPLE COVERING UP FOR THE KILLER BECAUSE HE WAS DEEMED ONE OF THOSE PILLAR OF SOCIETY TYPES IN HIS TOWN.

HOW SAD.... WITH HIS BACKGROUND RECORD- SO MANY LIVES COULD HAVE BEEN SAVED, IF HE HAD BEEN TREATED LIKE ANYONE ELSE WHO GETS INTO TROUBLE WAY TOO OFTEN.

THIS IS A CASE OF WHEN THE LAW AND TOWNSPEOPLE LOOK THE OTHER WAY- THE END RESULT IS PEOPLE DIE NEEDLESSLY.

WATCH IT, IF ONLY TO LEARN ABOUT A SERIAL KILLER LONG FORGOTTEN AND ALSO NOT AS WELL KNOWN AS OTHERS.

The good things about this movie:
*It really is based on the true story of a series of killings that took place in Alaska in the 1970's-80's. It doesnt just use those crimes as a coat hanger on which to hang all sorts of extreme elaborations and fabrications. It stays as close to some of the real events as a popular movie can be expected to stay.
*In keeping with its realism, it was largely filmed on location, giving audiences a sense of Anchorages steely industrial nature and its icy insularity.
*It keeps to a clean line of good versus evil. It doesnt feel it necessary to muddy the proceedings by giving the lead police officer on the case, played by Nicholas Cage, an artificially anguished background of battling alcoholism, ex-wives, and failed fatherhood.
*There are extensive bonus features on this DVD, including a fairly interesting producer/director commentary.

The bad things about this movie:
It never really comes off the screen and develops into a memorable three-dimensional portrayal. The intentions of everyone connected with the film were good. They wanted, not so much to magnify the deeds of the killer, but to show the humanity of his victims. They particularly wanted to feature the experiences of the killers one surviving victim who then becomes key to tracking him.

But this young woman, who, like the killers other victims, was practicing as a prostitute in the large Red Light District of testosterone-soaked Anchorage, never did become quite real or comprehensible, to me at least. We don't get to fully understand why, after her narrow escape from the killer, she would risk going back, not only generally to her old life as a prostitute - but specifically to the bars her killer is likely to frequent and where hes likely to spot her again. Her actions, as portrayed here, seem too self-destructive to be believable.

So in general, this is an earnest attempt at representing a crime, but I found that as soon as I finished the movie, it started to melt from my memory, like the ice on Anchorage streets come springtime.

I enjoy films that are based on true events, especially when the film adaptations are horror or thrillers.  THE FROZEN GROUND is a dash of both, and this adaptation is very entertaining.  It also stars a couple of actors that I really like:  Nicholas Cage and John Cusack.  Both do an excellent job in this flick, and the result is a great film worthy of your attention.

I wasn't sure what to expect going into this one.  I knew what it was about, but I wasn't sure if a full movie could be made about the topic, especially since the audience would already know who the killer was going into it.  But Im happy to report the writer and production team do a fantastic job of weaving an intense tale within this film.  It never once lags nor disappoints in any way.

THE FROZEN GROUND is shot well and looks amazing onscreen.  I tip my hat to the cinematography crew for capturing the majesty of Alaska (the film is shot on-location in and around Anchorage); the backdrops alone are enough of a reason to watch this movie.

But the story and characters are truly what drive this picture.  Set in 1983, the film is a powerhouse of emotional turmoil and undulating suspense as it recreates the events that led up to the capture of Robert Hansen.  The cast does an amazing job in their roles (and yes, I am one of the minority of people who thinks Nicholas Cage can act).  I am particularly impressed with Vanessa Hudgens, who portrays the young prostitute that escapes Hansens captivity; she owns her role with the zeal and talent of a veteran screen actress.

If I were forced to find a flaw with THE FROZEN GROUND, I simply could not do so.  Theres nothing wrong with the film in my opinion.  It looks great, the acting is top notch, and the story moves at a perfect pace.  For these reasons, I recommend giving this film a look.  It is suspenseful and powerful, a perfect flick to warm up these chilly nights.  The film is available now in a variety of formats.
